properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 13 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Noblesville.
* from late Saturday night to Monday evening.
* At  7:45 AM Friday the stage was 5.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late Saturday night and
continue to rise to near 16.2 feet by Sunday afternoon.  It will
fall below flood stage by Monday morning.
* At 16.2 feet...Flooding begins in the Trails End area of E 116th
Street.  The lowest house in the area has one foot of water in its
basement.  Another resident has two feet of water in his garage.
Flooding along River Road in rural Carmel.  Some residents south of
E 116th Street along River Drive East must park vehicles on high
ground.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
